content:
advertisement

For the second weekend in a row State College film fans will get a chance to see Humphrey Bogart when his  film  comes to the big screen PERIOD

Jonathan Eburne a professor of comparative literature and English said the movie is one of the first films that made Bogart an icon PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

A week after the State Theatre showed the Bogart film  Centre County Reads will present  Sunday at the State Theatre PERIOD Dashiell Hammetts  novel of the same name was this years Centre County Reads official selection for discussion and the film screening will coincide with that selection PERIOD

The film stars Bogart as a private detective who is involved with multiple plots to obtain a mysterious falcon statue PERIOD

James West a professor of English at Penn State who will give an introduction at the screening said the film adaptation is perfect PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

There are almost no differences between the stories and much of the dialogue in the film is taken directly from the novel he said PERIOD

Eburne said he agreed with Professor West PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

The screening will also be followed by the announcement of the winners of the Dashiell Hammett Writing Contest and a reception for the winners PERIOD

Eburne who is collaborating with Centre County Reads on the project through Penn States Arts in Public Life series said a winning entry will first and foremost be a piece of good writing PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Eburne will also host a luncheon series  p.m PERIOD Monday in  Kern Building to further discuss the novel PERIOD

For the film screening itself West said he will talk about the level of mistrust in the film and the idea that viewers cant really believe what any of the characters are saying PERIOD

He said people are drawn to this type of film or book because they like to see stories of good versus evil PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

Eburne who researches experimental literature and crime fiction said this type of story is currently popular citing Dan Browns novels as an example PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

He said the novel was more than just a detective story  its a work of modernist literature because of its strippeddown prose PERIOD

West said Hammetts background also may have added to the authenticity of the work PERIOD He said that while he started his literary career at the lowest level he was recognized for his talent and also worked as a private detective PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

A major draw of the film is its cinematography and its place in the film noir genre PERIOD Film noir has a sinister and threatening style that not all detective movies have West said PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Eburne said Bogarts popularity as a film icon is intriguing PERIOD He cites his looks and in particular the shape of his head as a curious feature of his popularity PERIOD

 he said PERIOD
